SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.sonyericsson.capuchin
Class FlashImage

java.lang.Object
  com.sonyericsson.capuchin.FlashImage

public class FlashImage
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an instance of the Flash engine associated with some Flash content(.swf).

This class is also used for dispatching user key and control events to the underlying Flash engine.

It provides methods for registering handles for data transfers between Java and Flash.

Code example:Create a FlashImage from a resource embedded in the MIDlet suite 
 .... 
 FlashImage flashImage;
 ApplicationResourceHandler  flashRH = new ApplicationResourceHandler();
 InputStream is = getClass().getResourceAsStream("/Clock.swf");
 ...
  try {
    flashImage = FlashImage.createImage(is,flashRH);
  }
 ....

Method Detail

createImage

public static FlashImage createImage(java.io.InputStream flashContent,
                                     ExternalResourceHandler externalRH)
                              throws java.io.IOException

Creates a FlashImage with the Flash content available from an InputStream.

It also registers an ExternalResourceHandler for loading external resources referred within the Flash content.

Parameters:
flashContent - the InputStream from where to load the Flash content (.swf).
externalRH - the ExternalResourceHandler provided by the application. If this parameter is null the default content handler is used for loading external resources.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if any error when reading the content.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if flashContent is null.

dispatchCommand

public void dispatchCommand(int command)

Dispatches a command to the Flash Engine that changes the animation state.

Note that the Flash engine will automatically be paused when it is covered or minimized without altering the current state. The Flash Engine will continue in the previous state when it is visible again.

Parameters:
command - the command to the Flash Engine, the possible values: COMMAND_PLAY, COMMAND_STOP, COMMAND_PAUSE, COMMAND_RESUME.

dispatchKeyEvent

public void dispatchKeyEvent(int keyCode,
                             int type)
Dispatches a key event from the Flash Engine.

Parameters:
keyCode - the key code associated with this event.
type - specifies if the key has been pressed or released, the possible values: KEY_PRESSED, KEY_RELEASED.

dispatchPointerEvent

public void dispatchPointerEvent(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int type)
Dispatches a pointer event to the Flash Engine.

Parameters:
x - the horizontal location where the pointer was located.
y - the vertical location where the pointer was located.
type - the event type, possible values: POINTER_DRAGGED, POINTER_PRESSED, POINTER_RELEASED.

render

public int render(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
Renders a frame of the Flash content. If necessary the frame will be scaled, to fit in the paint area.

Parameters:
g - the Graphics object to be used for rendering the Flash frame.
x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner where to begin drawing the Flash frame.
y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner where to begin drawing the Flash frame.
width - the width of the paint area where to draw the Flash frame.
height - the height of the paint area where to draw the Flash frame.
Returns:
milliseconds until next rendering cycle.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if g is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height are negative.
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - if there is not enough available memory for rendering the Flash content.

setFlashDataRequestListener

public void setFlashDataRequestListener(FlashDataRequestListener requestListener)
Sets a FlashDataRequestListener object for receiving the Flash data requests. This method will unregister a previous registered listener if requestListener is null.

Parameters:
requestListener - implements FlashDataRequestListener interface.

setFlashEventManager

public void setFlashEventManager(FlashEventManager eventManager)
Sets a FlashEventManager object for registering custom events defined in Flash. This method will unregister a previous registered manager if eventManager is null .

Parameters:
eventManager - implements FlashEventManager interface.

resourceAvailable

public void resourceAvailable(java.lang.String URI,
                              java.io.InputStream resourceData)
                       throws java.io.IOException

This method is called when an external resource is available.

Setting null as the resourceData indicates that the resource could not be fetched.

Parameters:
URI - the resource URI that was requested.
resourceData - input stream containing the external resource.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while loading the resource.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if URI is null.
See Also:
ExternalResourceHandler
